lines.content: * The main entry point of the Shermszz Chatbot Application.
* Initializes the UI, Storage and TaskList components and runs the command loop.
private Ui ui; //In charge of user interface, all the print statements are done in the ui object
* Initializes the application with the specified file path.
* Attempts to laod existing data from storage; create a new list if loading fails.
* @param filepath The file path where task data is stored.
this.tasks = new TaskList(); //If the file is unable to load in the storage, we default an empty list
* Continuously reads user commands, parses them, and executes the corresponding logic
* until the exit command is issued
LocalDate targetDate = Parser.parseSchedule(command); //shermszz.parser.Parser returns the date
int idx = Parser.parseMarking(command, this.tasks.getSize()); // Will retrieve the id of the task we want to mark as done
//Within range, so we mark the task
this.ui.showMarked(t, "This task is already marked as completed.");
this.ui.showMarked(t, "Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
int idx = Parser.parseUnmarking(command, this.tasks.getSize()); //Will retrieve the id of the task we want to unmark
//Within range, so we mark the task
this.ui.showUnmarked(t, "This task has yet to be completed.");
this.ui.showUnmarked(t, "Ok, I've unmarked this task to be not done yet:");
this.ui.showError("Invalid Date Format. Please use YYYY-MM-DD (e.g. 2025-01-28 to represent 28th Jan 2025) to represent the deadline date.");
private void addEventTask(String command) throws EventFormatException {
String[] eventParts = Parser.parseEvent(command); //[ description, /from date, /to date ]
Task t = new Event(description, start, end);
this.ui.showError("Invalid Date Format. Please use YYYY-MM-DD (e.g. 2025-01-28 to represent 28th Jan 2025) to represent the 2 dates required for an shermszz.task.Event task.");
* The main method to start the application.
* Signals that the user input for a Deadline command does not follow the required format.
* Thrown when the "/by" delimiter or the date is missing/invalid.
* Constructs a new DeadlineFormatException with the specified error message.
* @param message The error message explaining the missing delimiter or invalid arguments.
* Signals that the user input for a Delete command is invalid.
* Thrown when the task index argument is missing, not a number, or out of the bounds of the task list.
* Constructs a new DeleteFormatException with the specified error message.
* @param message The error message explaining why the delete command is invalid.
* Signals that the user input for an Event command does not comply with the expected format.
* Thrown when the "/from" or "/to" delimiters are missing, or if the start time is placed after the end time.
* Constructs a new EventFormatException with the specified error message.
* @param message The error message explaining the missing or invalid event details.
* Signals that a critical error occurred while attempting to save task data to the hard disk.
* Thrown when the storage directory cannot be created or the file cannot be written to.
* Constructs a new FileSaveException with the specified error message.
* @param message The error message explaining why the save operation failed.
* Signals that the user input for a Mark or Unmark command is invalid.
* Thrown when the target task index is missing, not a valid integer, or refers to a non-existent task.
* Constructs a new MarkFormatException with the specified error message.
* @param message The error message explaining why the mark/unmark command is invalid.
* Signals that the user input for the Schedule command is invalid.
* Thrown when the date argument is missing or cannot be parsed into the standard YYYY-MM-DD format.
* Constructs a new ScheduleFormatException with the specified error message.
* @param message The error message explaining the invalid date format or missing argument.
* Represents the base exception for all logic and runtime errors specific to the Shermszz application.
* All other custom exceptions in this application should inherit from this class.
* The detailed error message associated with this exception.
* Constructs a new ShermszzException with the specified detail message.
* @param errorMessage The error message explaining the cause of the exception.
* Signals that the user input for a Todo command does not follow the required format.
* Thrown when the description of the todo task is empty or missing.
* Constructs a new TodoFormatException with the specified error message.
* @param message The error message explaining why the todo format is invalid.
* Signals that the command entered by the user is not recognized by the application.
* Thrown when the first word of the input string does not match any valid {@code Command} enum.
* Constructs a new UnknownCommandException with the specified error message.
* @param message The error message indicating that the command entered is not recognized.
* Represents the valid commands that can be executed by the user.
* These commands drive the main control flow of the application.
/** Command to add a Todo task. */
/** Command to add a Deadline task. */
/** Command to add an Event task. */
/** Command to mark a task as done. */
/** Command to mark a task as not done. */
/** Command to view tasks on a specific schedule. */
* Parses user input into actionable commands and extracts task details.
* This class serves as the interface between raw user input and the application's logic.
* It handles the breakdown of command strings, validation of formats, and extraction
* of arguments for task creation and modification.
* Parses the full command string to identify the specific command type.
* Converts the first word of the input into a standard {@code Command} enum.
* @param fullCommand The full input string entered by the user.
* @return The {@code Command} corresponding to the user's input.
* @throws UnknownCommandException If the command word does not match any known command.
public static Command parse(String fullCommand) throws UnknownCommandException {
throw new UnknownCommandException("Your command \"" + commandWord + "\" is invalid.");
* Parses the arguments for a Todo command.
* Extracts the description part of the command string.
* @param command The full command string (e.g., "todo read book").
* @return The description of the todo task.
* @throws TodoFormatException If the description is empty or the format is invalid.
public static String parseTodo(String command) throws TodoFormatException {
throw new TodoFormatException("Please enter a valid todo format as follows: todo <description>");
* Extracts the description and deadline date from a Deadline command.
* @return A String array where index 0 is the description and index 1 is the due date.
* @throws DeadlineFormatException If the "/by" delimiter is missing.
public static String[] parseDeadline(String command) throws DeadlineFormatException {
throw new DeadlineFormatException("Invalid format. Use deadline <description> /by YYYY-MM-DD");
String description = command.substring(9, byIndex).trim(); //returns the description just before "/by" and after "deadline "
String dueBy = command.substring(byIndex + 3).trim(); // Start index is right after /by
* Extracts the description, start time, and end time from an Event command.
* @return A String array where index 0 is description, 1 is start time, and 2 is end time.
* @throws EventFormatException If "/from" or "/to" delimiters are missing or unordered.
public static String[] parseEvent(String command) throws EventFormatException {
throw new EventFormatException("Please enter a valid event format as follows: event <description>  /from <start date> /to <due date>");
* Parses the task index from a mark command.
* Validates that the index is a number and exists within the current task list.
* @param size    The current size of the task list (used for validation).
* @return The 1-based index of the task to be marked.
* @throws MarkFormatException If the index is missing, not a number, or out of bounds.
public static int parseMarking(String command, int size) throws MarkFormatException {
String[] parts = command.split(" "); //Should be mark X, where X is a number
throw new MarkFormatException("You must specify a task to mark after typing \"mark\"");
int idx = Integer.parseInt(parts[1]); //Could throw NumberFormatExecption if a digit isnt entered
throw new MarkFormatException("Cannot mark task with ID = " + idx + ". It does not exist.");
throw new MarkFormatException("Please specify a valid task ID number.");
* Parses the task index from an unmark command.

public static int parseUnmarking(String command, int size) throws MarkFormatException {
String[] parts = command.split(" "); //Should be mark X, where X is a number
throw new MarkFormatException("You must specify a task to unmark after typing \"unmark\"");
throw new MarkFormatException("Cannot unmark task with ID =  " + idx + ". It does not exist.");
throw new MarkFormatException("Please specify a valid task ID number.");

* Parses the schedule command to extract the target date.

public static LocalDate parseSchedule(String command) throws ScheduleFormatException {

* Saves the current list of tasks to the data file.
* Overwrites the existing file with the current state of the TaskList.

public void save(TaskList tasks) throws FileSaveException {

* Represents a task with a specific deadline.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Represents an event that occurs within a specific time range.
* @param description  The description of the event.
* @param start        The start time of the event.
* @param end          The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, String start, String end) {
this.start = LocalDate.parse(start); //Start and end should be in YYYY-MM-DD format
return "[E]" + super.toString() + " (from: " + this.start.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy")) + " to: " + this.end.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy")) + ")";
* Represents a generic task in the Shermszz application.
* This abstract class serves as the parent for specific task types (Todo, Deadline, Event).
* It encapsulates the common behaviors such as description storage and completion status management.
* Constructs a new Task with the specified description.
* Initializes the completion status to false (incomplete).
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the status icon of the task.
* @return "X" if the task is done, " " otherwise.
* Returns the completion status of the task.
* @return true if the task is marked as done, false otherwise.
* Updates the internal status to true.
* Updates the internal status to false.
* Checks if the task is scheduled to occur on the specified date.
* Default implementation returns false; subclasses should override this
* if they are associated with specific dates.
* @param date The date to check against.
* @return true if the task occurs on the given date, false otherwise.
public boolean isOccurringOn(LocalDate date) { return false; } //Default is to return false, since a general task may or may not have a deadline
* Formats the task data for storage in the hard disk.
* @return A string formatted for file storage (e.g., "T | 1 | description").
* Represents the list of tasks in the Shermszz application.
* This class encapsulates an {@code ArrayList<Task>} and provides methods to
* manipulate the list, such as adding, deleting, and retrieving tasks.
* Initializes the internal list to an empty {@code ArrayList}.
* Constructs a {@code TaskList} containing the given tasks.
* Useful when loading existing data from storage.
* @param tasks An {@code ArrayList} of {@code Task} objects to populate the list.
* Adds a task to the list.
* @param t The {@code Task} object to be added.
* Removes the task at the specified position in the list.
* @param index The zero-based index of the task to be removed.
* Retrieves the task at the specified position in the list.
* @param index The zero-based index of the task to return.
* @return The {@code Task} at the specified position.
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* @return The size of the task list.
* Represents a task without any specific date or time constraint.
* A {@code Todo} task only contains a description and a completion status.
* Constructs a {@code Todo} task with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the task.

System.out.println("Hello from under the water! I am Spongebob here to record your tasks in my pineapple.");
